ygData.subject: Re: access to last version and importing to nutchwax
ygData.msgSnippet: Thank you Gordon. I switched back to jdk.1.6.0_22 and heritrix produced arcs that nutchwax was able to import. Regards, Nacho

Thank you Gordon. I switched back to jdk.1.6.0_22 and heritrix produced ar=
cs that nutchwax was able to import.

Regards,
Nacho



--- In archive-craw=
ler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> On 6/7/11 5:02 AM,=
 nch2012 wrote:
> > Hi,
> > I am trying to build the latest version availab=
le of heritrix.
> > The link
> > http://builds.archive.org:8080/maven2/org/=
archive/heritrix/heritrix/3.1.0-beta/heritrix-3.1.0-beta-dist.tar.gz
> > se=
ems to be down.
> 
> Yes, the 'builds.archive.org' machine is still having =
issues and the 
> full replacement is still being prepared. The very latest=
 H3 development 
> builds are available from the new Jenkins-based build bo=
x, accessible 
> for now at:
> 
> https://ia410225.us.archive.org:1443/
> 
=
> Generally if you would have been comfortable with the 3.1.0-beta a 
> 3.1=
.0-SNAPSHOT would be appropriate too (and we always appreciate the 
> help =
testing the latest code in preparation for an official release).
> 
> > Is =
this the last version available? With subversion I downloaded heritrix3, is=
 it older than heritrix 1.14.4?
> > Why are two numbering sequences being u=
sed? I mean "heritrix 1, 2, 3" and then also "heritrix 1.14.3, 1.14.4...."
=
> 
> Roughly changes to the leading digit (eg "1.", "2.", "3." aka "major 
=
> version") mean there are big, backward incompatible changes that users 
>=
 of previous editions will want to understand before upgrading. Changes 
> =
to the second digit (eg "1.12", "1.14", "3.0", "3.1" aka "minor 
> version"=
) indicate some new functionality but generally painless 
> transitions for=
ward if you familiarize yourself with the Release Notes 
> for the releases=
 between what you're using and what you're moving to. 
> Changes to the thi=
rd digit (eg "1.14.1", "1.14.2", "1.14.3" aka "micro" 
> or "patch" or "poi=
nt release") mean mostly fixes and small changes, and 
> often (but unfortu=
nately not always) configurations can be brought 
> forward with no conscio=
us effort.
> 
> Even as later major versions are developed, some people can=
't move right 
> away, so small fix point releases will continue on the ear=
lier major 
> version. (Heritrix 2 went through a second major configuratio=
n change 
> after its first release, but before any widespread adoption, so=
 
> essentially everyone using Heritrix should be on either 1.14.x or 3.0+ =

> and no other H2 point releases are expected.) Our expected next few 
> o=
fficial releases are:
> 
> 3.1.0 final
> 1.14.5
> 3.1.1
> 
> There will pro=
bably eventually be a 1.14.6 if institutions keep using it 
> and there are=
 necessary fixes that accumulate, but there probably won't 
> be a 1.16.0.
=
> 
> At this point, people starting fresh who can handle XML-based 
> confi=
guration editing, or people doing their own code customizations in 
> Java,=
 are urged to start with a Heritrix 3 release. People on projects 
> that a=
lready have experience with Heritrix 1 and are used-to or more 
> comfortab=
le with its form-fields-based configuration can wait until they 
> feel the=
y need something in H3.
> 
> 
> > I am going crazy with the gzip problem: I=
 cannot get nutchwax to import any arc produced by heritrix. Is this gzip p=
roblem solved in 3.1.0? I am using jdk1.6.0_25
> 
> The latest dev builds (=
including 3.1.0-beta and the 3.1.0-SNAPSHOT 
> builds on the new build mach=
ine referenced above) have a workaround for 
> the GZIP-reading issues intr=
oduced by JDK6u23-and-above. If you can get 
> your nutchwax version to use=
 the latest (W)ARC-reading code, which may 
> take a little work, it should=
 resolve your issues. Or, you could go back 
> to JDK6u22 or earlier.
> 
> =
Hope this helps,
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> > Thanx in advance to anyone who m=
ight help.
> > Nacho
> >
> >
> >
> >
